definition: posthumous honorific name
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
to confer a posthumous title
posthumous name and title
to accept abdication
to succeed to a title/to inherit
to succeed to the throne/accession
to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
smiling face
variant of 諡|谥[shi4]
to succeed to the throne
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
Emperor Ruizong of Tang, reign name of sixth Tang emperor Li Dan 李旦[Li3 Dan4] (662-716), reigned 684-690 and 710-712
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
Cao Pi 曹丕, emperor of Wei 220-226
Emperor Gaozu of Tang, reign name of first Tang emperor Li Yuan 李淵|李渊[Li3 Yuan1] (566-635), reigned 618-626
